case_vignette: A previously healthy 6-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a 3-day history of progressive rash. The rash started on his face and now involves the entire body. For the past week, he has had a cough and a runny nose. He is visiting from the Philippines with his family. He is in first grade and spends his afternoons at an after-school child care program. Immunization records are not available. His temperature is 39.5°C (103°F), pulse is 115/min, and blood pressure is 105/66 mm Hg. Examination shows generalized lymphadenopathy. There is an erythematous maculopapular, blanching, and partially confluent exanthem on his entire body. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've had a spreading rash for 3 days, starting from my face to my whole body, and I've been coughing and having a runny nose for the past week.
How old are you?
I'm 6 years old.
Do you have a fever or any signs of high body temperature?
Yes, I have a fever; my temperature is really high.
Have you noticed any white spots inside your mouth or a sore throat along with these symptoms?
No, I haven't noticed any white spots in my mouth or a sore throat.
Have you been vaccinated for measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR)?
My immunization records are not available.
Has anyone in your family or your close contacts had similar symptoms recently?
You did not provide me with this information.
Have you been in contact with anyone who has similar symptoms, or have you traveled recently?
I am visiting from the Philippines with my family.
Are you experiencing any difficulty breathing or wheezing?
No, I am not having any trouble breathing or wheezing.
Do you have any history of allergies or asthma?
I was previously healthy with no mention of allergies or asthma.
Final Diagnosis: Measles
